title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in reader mode
description: When opening a page in reader mode the redirect URL could have caused attacker-controlled script to execute in a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attack.

title: Media permission request prompt showing from background tab
description: The permission request prompt from the site in the background tab was overlaid on top of the site in the foreground tab.

title: Browser crashed when session restore was called with an empty body
description: The session restore helper crashed whenever there was no parameter sent to the message handler.

title: Privileged internal URL protection could be bypassed through referrer header.
description: Internal URLs are protected by a secret UUID key which could have been leaked to web page through the Referrer header.

title: SQL injection in history tab
description: The search term could have been specified externally to trigger SQL injection.

title: File download shares private browsing mode cookies
description: When a download was initiated the client did not check whether it was in normal or private browsing mode which led to private mode cookies being shared in normal browsing mode.

title: Download JS user script can be overidden
description: A rogue webpage could override the injected WKUserScript used by the download feature this exploit could result in the user downloading an unintended file.

title: Login JS user script can be overidden
description: A rogue webpage could override the injected WKUserScript used by the logins autofill this exploit could result in leaking a password for the current domain.

title: Download Feature unicode RTLO char can fake the file extension
description: A unicode RTL order character in the downloaded file name can be used to change the file's name during the download UI flow to change the file extension.

title: IndexedDB persists in private browsing mode
description: IndexedDB should be cleared when leaving private browsing mode and it is not the API for WKWebViewConfiguration was being used incorrectly and requires the private instance of this object be deleted when leaving private mode.

title: Native-to-JS bridging security token exploit
description: For native-to-JS bridging the app requires a unique token to be passed that ensures non-app code can't call the bridging functions. That token could leak when used for downloading files.

title: Native-to-JS bridging security token exploit
description: For native-to-JS bridging the app requires a unique token to be passed that ensures non-app code can't call the bridging functions. That token was being used for JS-to-native also but it isn't needed in this case and its usage was also leaking this token.
